topics.body:
"@ParagonCommander":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548f40d76368726e79971800#post_548f40d76368726e79971800
The problem with counter-terrorism is that it's impossible to prevent standalone attacks because the current strategy is to prevent large scale attacks like 9/11 by focusing on organizations and such.  Standalone attacks are impossible to prevent due to they are not part of a organization but motivated by their beliefs and such.  The people that go, "well why don't we <x> to prevent standalone attacks" are complete and utter fucking morons because attacks like these are impossible to prevent.

As time goes on we'll see less large scale attacks like 9/11, the boston bombing or such and instead more attacks like these because they are without a doubt 100% impossible to prevent.  The only way anyone could possible prevent standalone attacks is if we imprisoned everyone from birth to death for the sake of their "safety" and even then chances are we would still have terrorist attacks by standalone individuals of individuals that would hypothetically be there for people's "safety".

If you want to know what I mean by standalones watch Ghost in the Shell season 1; it's a good summary into how standalones come into existence and are motivated by ideals rather than being a part of a organization or such.

Pretty much attacks like these are impossible to prevent and anyone in the news or mass media who claims they are preventable are pants on head slang definition of retarded.
